lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court ruled Tuesday that police may search a home without a warrant when two occupants disagree about allowing officers to enter, and the resident who refuses access is then arrested.

headline.main: High Court Allows Disputed Home Search
headline.print_headline: High Court Allows Disputed Home Search

snippet: The Supreme Court ruled Tuesday that police may search a home without a warrant when two occupants disagree about allowing officers to enter, and the resident who refuses access is then arrested....
